United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

bites.bite: In Tokelau, there are 5 funder_ref(s) working in 19 sector_group(s).
The largest sector_group is Basic health with 12 reports followed by Disaster prevention and preparedness with 11 reports.

The largest activity_url is http://d-portal.org/q.html?aid=XM-DAC-928-TK-2020-21-01.001.WP01.TKL02 with 8 reports followed by http://d-portal.org/q.html?aid=XM-DAC-928-TK-2020-21-01.001.WP01.TKL05 with 4 reports.
The largest funder_ref is NZ with 39 reports followed by XM-DAC-928 with 33 reports.
The largest reporting is New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade with 39 reports followed by World Health Organization with 33 reports.
The largest reporting_ref is NZ-1 with 39 reports followed by XM-DAC-928 with 33 reports.

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: The Initiation Plan Phase Project seeks to begin the process of improving the transparency, accountability and efficiency of the public sector in Tokelau to help ensure the effective delivery of basic public services on the atolls.
Strengthening the Quarantine & Isolation Capacity across the three Atolls in line with Tokelau COVID-19 Preparedness and Response Plan, and long term use
Integrated and Inclusive COVID-19 Response for Tokelau that leaves no one behind

Supporting the COVID-19 Socio-Economic Impact Assessment (SEIA) of Tokelau to better gauge the situation on the ground and suggest longer-term solutions as part of establishing social protection floor for vulnerable groups

Increased capacity of countries to deliver key HIV interventions through active engagement in policy dialogue, development of normative guidance and tools, dissemination of strategic information, and provision of technical support
Population policies / programmes and reproductive health
Development and/or implementation of national multisectoral policies and plans to prevent and control noncommunicable diseases accelerated
Other prevention and treatment of NCDs
Countries with technical capacity to develop integrated mental health services across the continuum of promotion, prevention, treatment and recovery

Countries enabled to develop, implement and monitor action plans based on the maternal, infant and young child nutrition comprehensive implementation plan, which takes into consideration the double burden of malnutrition

Countries enabled to implement and monitor integrated strategic plans for newborn and child health, with a focus on expanding access to high-quality interventions to improve early childhood development and end preventable newborn and child deaths from pneumonia, diarrhoea and other conditions
Population policies / programmes and reproductive health

Countries enabled to assess health risks and develop and implement policies, strategies or regulations for the prevention, mitigation and management of the health impacts of environmental and occupational risks

Improved country governance capacity to formulate, implement and review comprehensive national health policies, strategies and plans (including multisectoral action and health in all policies and equity policies)
Health workforce strategies oriented towards universal health coverage implemented in countries

Countries enabled to develop or update, implement, monitor and evaluate national policies on better access to medicines and other health technologies; and to strengthen their evidence-based selection and rational use

Research priorities and comprehensive reviews of vaccination policies for new vaccines and other immunization-related technologies defined and agreed, in order to develop and introduce vaccines of public health importance and overcome barriers to immunization

Support to strengthen governance and public sector capability to improve decision making and effective use of resources.
New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
Public sector policy and administrative management
Support to strengthen governance and public sector capability to improve decision making and effective use of resources.
New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

The Activity will enhance Tokelau's resilience to disasters and climate change by addressing hazards identified in the Tokelau Coastal Hazard Study which have also been prioritised by village councils, and by preparing detailed designs and a business case for emergency shelters and infrastructure upgrade options.
New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

Co-financing and technical assistance to expand RE infrastructure and replace components at end of life. This will support Tokelau's sustainable energy generation and minimise any reliance on fossil fuels.
New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

The Activity takes a multi-faceted approach to improving education in Tokelau, with a focus on NZ education agencies and suppliers assisting Tokelau's Department of Education to implement its secondary and digital education strategies and to successfully integrate with the NZ education qualifications system.
New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

This activity will complement and reinforce the Professional Learning and Development by Massey by incentivising key education reforms and addressing major impediments to improving the quality of education.
This activity will transfer DFAT's contribution to the Government of Tokelau to create and publish Tokelau language educational resources.
New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
This activity will ensure that necessary technical assistance is provided in a timely way to progress key activities, and to strengthen the Government of Tokelau's public financial management.
New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
